intro: Calycocorsus tuberosus, commonly known as the tuberous calycocorsus, is a unique plant species characterized by its distinctive tuberous roots. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture and emits a mild, aromatic scent. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often displaying shades of white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
